intro: Neurocarpum retusum, commonly known as the smooth neurocarpum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, particularly in Europe and parts of Asia. The plant features a slender, erect stem with finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a fine, silky hair. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Neurocarpum retusum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
